String.Source: This one's mine!
I've located the whereabouts of a vampire masquerading as a common citizen.
But for Serana's sake, I'll assist you in any way that I can.
It's really too bad, you know. The little accident you had here, completely unexpected...
Put his mind to rest, allay his fear through vampiric seduction and when he is in a pliant condition, embrace him and bite him on the neck.
Wait, what? That's not what we agreed. We take it back together.
Hsss...
Well of course they did.
Although I would gladly die by your hand, perhaps I could offer an alternative way to read the scrolls?
When you offer the embrace, do so away from prying eyes. Our new sibling will then likely require rest while her blood undergoes the change.
I can't guarantee you'd be free from harm. Becoming blind could be the least of your worries.
Your friend, kidnapped!
She had a theory about soul gems. That the souls inside of them don't just vanish when they're used... they end up in the Soul Cairn.
I'm afraid in my haste to read the first scroll, I neglected the time I needed to prepare. The failure is purely mine to bear.
It's not exactly the hospitality I'm used to, but your man Isran has seen to my needs well enough.
Should your husband go missing, perhaps unable to bear the thought of living with a... a monster...
Should your blushing bride go missing, perhaps unable to bear the thought of living with a... a monster...
My sincerest pardons, I but look after your own peace of mind.
The air, the ground... this is all wrong.
In my language, the Qahnaarin is the Vanquisher, the one who has bested a fellow dovah in battle.
Now you decide to give up? Fine. I'll be here.
All right. Good luck.
I believe there's more to it than that.
It's ruled by unseen beings known as the Ideal Masters.
Go cull the brutish beasts before the problem gets out of hand.
Let me see it. ...Huh...
Make it seem you are a member of the Dawnguard, thus sowing confusion among the herd. Wear this armor and plant this note on the victim.
What happened to this place?
If only such a miracle existed, I'd overcome the impossible in order to secure it if it meant pleasing you.
Isran? My help?
The dovah roamed the skies, vying for their small slices of territory that resulted in immense and ultimately fatal battles.
I saw more than enough political maneuvering in my time in House Dres. I was tired of it then, and I'm tired of it now.
Indeed. It is no small thing to submit yourself to the flesh sculptor's knife.
Fine, fine. No need to get your breeches in a twist.
I can't even begin to imagine how much time she spent in this room. Doesn't look too cozy.
That doesn't exactly make me want to open up.
A Moth Priest? I'm sorry, but I don't know anything about that.
The Elder Scroll is just a bit further.
I am Harkon, lord of this court.
It's on an island near Solitude. Hopefully we can find a boat to take us there.
Do I detect a hint of reproach? I am only looking out for your best interests. And perhaps, a small measure of my own.
It's come to my inescapable attention that you, my dear friend, are married.
And here we are.
Really?
Lord Harkon has never cared to use the Chalice, relying on his more than adequate powers until now.
Lord Harkon. Remember your place.
I hope I have something that interests you. I always wish to be of service.
Anyway, I'm quite happy in my current pursuits. So if you'll excuse me...
Now, I believe that Lord Harkon wishes to speak with you.
Have you been listening to me? Like Serana, I'm a pure-blooded vampire. My presence on Tamriel is as much of a danger as hers.
Hmmm. Not bad. We'd better hope that's good enough. Mistakes with these kinds of portals can be... gruesome.
Well that's just fine. Orthjolf told me to finish off anyone who got in the way.
We're just lucky I was here to return the Chalice to Vingalmo, so he could make sure Harkon gets it back.
Excellent. That's one less beast and nest of broodlings we needn't worry about any longer.
Change it? I can remake your face, if that's what you desire.
And instead you found me. So what's your next step, now that I'm here?
You came for me? How did you know? I thought I was going to die in here. Thank you!
You'd think a vampire would be right at home in this place. You'd be wrong. Let's just find my mother and get out of here, quickly.
Very good. That should, for a time, direct the people's anger towards the Dawnguard and away from us.
I... I almost can't believe it. We did it! We actually did it!
Wonderful. I'll make the necessary preparations for infusion into the Chalice presently.
It's pointless and vague, like all prophecies. The part he latched onto said that vampires would no longer need to fear the sun.
What is your command?
What are you waiting for? Get out there and find a moth priest!
Come now, and hear my proclamation.
Look at the device here - the gear in the center is just about the right size. Try putting the shards in and... we'll see what happens.
Now that I have reclaimed one of my Elder Scrolls, we must find a Moth Priest to read it.
Don't know how well I'd have managed by myself. You have my thanks.
Oh, most certainly! Let's find out what secrets the scroll can tell.
Ah, my rescuer! It's good to see you again.
Come on, old man. You should get some rest.
Those last ones helped me immensely. If you could collect this one for me, it's sure to result in extraordinary success!
You have an Elder Scroll? Remarkable!
I don't recall addressing you, worm.
I had no idea you felt that way about me, Serana. It was never my intention to push you aside.
I never knew the darkness held such colors, or the night air smelled so sweet. You have given me a great gift.
I'll be here if you change your mind.
You think I'd have the audacity to place my own daughter in that tomb for the protection of her Elder Scroll alone?
The scrolls are merely a means to an end. The key to the Tyranny of the Sun is Serana herself.
We were once a wealthy and prosperous society that occupied a portion of Skyrim.
Well, I certainly can't help any less than the Vigilants of Stendarr, now can I?
I can certainly try.
Agh!
Hold still, then.
Got it into his head years back that his experience with animals would help. Trolls in particular, from what I hear.
Well... I trust you'll take care of this unwanted visitor. My guards will not interfere with you carrying out my justice.
This attack... it's unlike the vampires. Do we at least know what they were after, or is this completely a lost cause?
Oh, Serana. If you'd only open your eyes.
If eternal night fell, there are many who wouldn't stand for it. They would raise armies in attempts to return things to normal.
Once the Initiate completed his mantras, he'd dip a ceremonial ewer in the basin at the wayshrine's center and proceed to the next wayshrine.
A feral-blooded has holed up with a group of bandits. Likely wants to create a nest of broodlings.
Very good. That's one less monster we need to worry about.
What is it now?
At their bases, the barrier's energy is being drawn from unfortunate souls that have been exiled here.
Before my father became obsessed with the prophecy, mother and I spent quite a bit of time together.
Life here is better than you could find anywhere in Skyrim.
Thank you for your kindness. I'll remember it the next time I'm feeling hungry.
Your lack of planning fills me with confidence.
They slaughtered everyone and stormed the Inner Sanctum where I believe they corrupted Vyrthur.
Supposedly, they had to build a special forge, the Aetherium Forge, to even work with it.
The Soul Cairn has become a part of what I am. I can never fully call Tamriel my home again, or I would surely perish.
Your husband, kidnapped!
Hmm. Very well. Just tell me what you desire - beauty or hideous deformity, nothing is beyond my skill.
I can hardly believe it. This is it. We've actually found the Forge! At last!
Convince the Jarl of the threat and he'll let you destroy the creature. If not, then do your best not to get caught.
Orthjolf, I'm surprised!
If you wish to learn more about the bow, or obtain Sunhallowed Arrows for it, I'd be more than happy to help. You've but to ask.
He's obsessed... insane. Everyone around him fears him as they would a rabid dog.
Remember that Harkon isn't to be trusted. No matter what he promises, he'll deceive you in order to get what he wants.
Tell me more about what's going on.
Both of you were obsessed with your own paths. Your motivations might have been different, but in the end, I'm still just a pawn to you, too.
I've tracked this damned bear for two weeks; I'll not let it have any more victims.
In the meantime, we're going to get to the bottom of why a vampire showed up here looking for you.
All right. If nothing else, I suppose it wouldn't hurt to learn more about what's going on so I can better defend myself.
Of course! It is my duty to serve, and I am happy to do it!
Some Imperial scholar arrived in Skyrim a few days ago. I was staking out the road when I saw him pass by. Maybe that's your Moth Priest.
Vingalmo and Orthjolf are Harkon's primary advisors. I'm sure they're quite surprised to learn that you're taking the Chalice.
Keep searching for her notes. She probably had a journal or something.
No, you must be mistaken. He made it exceedingly clear the last time we spoke that he had no interest in my help.
Safe? You call bringing her here safe? Has she explained nothing to you?
I understand that, but I really can't leave here without at least one usable piece of dwarven equipment.
Maybe.
Our compassion compels us to destroy it.
Look, on the edge here. This has been cut, precisely cut. If you had another piece, about the same size, it would... it would snap right in.
As for the other, the last that I heard, it was lost in the bowels of a Dwemer ruin.
Master, I have done as you asked and traveled here.
He's been working on that place for years now. Never lets anyone in.
For all of this to end, he must die.
I'll meet you there.
Watch yourself. This bear is vicious.
Oh, he just left a short while ago. He said he'd finished up his work and it was time to move on.
And they have an Elder Scroll.
It's something all right.
I often wonder where we'd be if the Dwemer were still around. Ah well. We'll have to manage with the scraps we find.
You probably weren't expecting to see me again.
The Soul Cairn is home to very powerful beings. Necromancers send them souls, and receive powers of their own in return.
When you offer the embrace, do so away from prying eyes. Our new sibling will then likely require rest while his blood undergoes the change.
(grunt)
Vingalmo and Orthjolf both long for our Lord's throne, but cannot make overt moves against him.
You know as much as I do. I can't teach you anything new.
Anything else?
Right to the point, aren't you. I like that. Not like those fools in the order.
Sure, that's what they all say.
Hold it. If you're going downstairs, you keep your weapons to yourself or we'll be getting better acquainted.
It begins again.
By ensuring the Chalice reaches our Lord, you have increased his power over them, and at the same time deprived them of their little pets.
For the thousands of years I've served as the Chantry's sentinel, there hasn't been a single visitor here for any other reason.
Good work. It's always best to deal with a problem by ripping it out at the root.
An ancient font, full of power. As much as it looks like blood, sadly it is not. Can you imagine if it were? We'd never need to hunt again.
Remember your place, and you'll be taken care of.
Son of a...
An unattended attachment, such as found in your beloved wife creates... an opportunity for unnecessary agitation.
I'd... rather not get into that with you. If that's all right.
Indeed. He's off to Redwater Den.
She was so sure of what we did to my father, I couldn't help but go along with her. I never thought of the cost.
What?
My name is Serana. Who sent you here?
This is my savior, the one who freed me.
You need to locate the tallest of the rocky spires that surround these ruins.
What have you done to yourself? I can't work with you in this state, night-walker.
Here you are.
We need to find my mother, Valerica.
I don't know yet. The Moth Priest died before finishing the transcription, but he did name the Elder Scrolls that contained the prophecy.
And heed also this. He's no pet. Mistreat the beast or leave him alone for too long, and he'll return to the wild forgetting you ever existed.
We're also going to need a sample of her blood. Which... if we could get that, we wouldn't even be trying to do this in the first place.
Ah, well, in that case I'll tell you what I know.
I see... similar to the exploding bolt, only this one will cause damage with splintering shards of ice sharp as glass. Charming!
The previous owners of the castle had a sundial in the courtyard, and obviously that didn't appeal to my mother.
I don't feel... right... I'm going to lay down... for awhile...
You are a very welcome addition to this dreary place, my friend. I owe both you and Arkay a great deal.
I think my father wanted to see you. Have you talked to him yet?
Depends on who you ask. Some say Molag-Bal himself gave these rings to ancient powerful vampire lords. Some say that is just a myth.
Harkon himself disbelieved in their existence, though perhaps he felt slighted they were not already in his possession and only feigns indifference.
Even if I could, it would only serve to hinder your efforts.
Rrrraaaaahhhh!
Not... like... this...
Hey, watch it!
The last time I saw her, she said that she'd go somewhere safe... somewhere that my father would never search.
I see you've already taken it upon yourself to gather the information you seek.
Come on!
Got it!
None of the others ever made it this far.
Finally came to your senses, eh? Realized what you gave up?
When I fled Castle Volkihar, I fled with two Elder Scrolls.
As far as I've heard, no one's seen them and returned to Tamriel to tell about it.
Lord Harkon's orders, Orthjolf. Calm yourself.
It must have been important to the vampires as well, for them to risk an open attack on the Vigilants.
Then the rest is up to me.
And how exactly do you plan on completing the prophecy without the death of my daughter?
I promise to try and make this as painless as possible. Hold still.
So how has it come to pass that a vampire of mixed blood is in the company of my daughter?
Our sense of what's right is what separates us from the vampires. Don't forget that.
Tell you what, I'll sell it back to you for 4,000 coins.
When did I say that?
Like she didn't want to just stop my father... she wanted to stick it to him, too.
She always seemed happy, before we heard the prophecy. Then it all changed. She became a different person. They both did.
I trust your journey was successful?
The secret of the bow's power is written elsewhere. I think there is more to the prophecy, recorded in other scrolls.
Beautiful. That crown... it's everything I could have hoped for.
Something's wrong with the moondial here. Some of the crests are missing and the dial is askew.
She had to be up to something in that garden. I'm hoping it's a clue that will tell us where she went.
Oh please, milord. Please... forgive me!
Well, if you want to reach the summit, you're going to need some help. You... want a hand?
Otherwise, all I can do now is grant you my hopes for a safe journey.
If you need anything else, I'll be here.
I had no idea that her laboratory even existed.
Well, once the Initiate's enlightenment was complete, he'd bring the ewer to the Chantry's Inner Sanctum.
Since the Keepers weren't able to claim my soul, they had their minions construct a barrier that I'd never be able to breach.
Yeah, too bad. Lord Harkon's new favorite, dead so soon after joining the family.
If I had foreseen the value they placed on my own soul, I would never have come here.
We call such confluences the "Daughters of Coldharbour."
But no matter. The greatest artists are never recognized in their own time.
My father and I don't really get along.
Having trouble finding those ingredients?
Your intentions are still somewhat unclear to me.
Quickly now! The longer you delay, the more danger the Jarl is in.
I don't think so. She said she wanted to stay awake in case the situation was resolved.
I am more than happy to buy or sell whatever you might need.
Wait... that almost makes sense!
Fortunately, you're in a position to breach the barrier that surrounds these ruins.
Once that's done, the blood of a powerful vampire needs to be added to it.
Now, let me get the scroll's case opened.
Now tell me, who is this stranger you have brought into our hall?
A savior?
After what I've put Serana through, I would understand if she never wished to see me again. I leave that decision in your hands.
That Moth Priest, Dexion. He said we needed two other Elder Scrolls. I think I know where we can start looking.
Hey, if you don't like it, you could always shop for your Elder Scrolls elsewhere.
Pay a visit to the beast's last known contact. Do what you must to find where it's hiding now.
You care nothing for Serana or our plight.
I can crush skulls with the best of them. Let me show you a few things.
If I ventured far from the Soul Cairn, my strength would begin to wane until I was no more.
Before this, I roamed the skies above Tamriel. I desire to return there.
I must have failed. Harkon's found a way to decipher the prophecy, hasn't he.
You. Come forward. I would speak with you.
We'll get to that. For now, get acquainted with the space.
Certainly. Where can I find this castle?
Whatever it says, it will have something that can help us stop my father.
Despite my present low estate, I am no beggar. Begone until you have the coin to warrant my skills.
I have ordered the court to assemble. I have a new task for us all to carry out, and that includes you.
Hang on... could you pull that again?
I'll buy whatever you're looking to get rid of.
I know that better than anybody.
We usually feed on our visitors, but perhaps we'll make an exception in your case.
Unh... where is... who sent you here?
I didn't want you to think I was one of those... you know, the women who just sit in their castle all day?
You'd do well to watch that tongue, elf.
All right. Here goes.
We end this here and now!
Refuse me, and I will banish you from this castle. I will spare your life this once, but after that, you are prey.
My lord! Everyone! Serana has returned!
Ah, welcome, welcome! I don't believe we've seen you here before, have we? You can buy from me, then join any booth you'd like.
No one ever escapes. There is no escape. Why would you even try?
Make use of my coffin whenever you like. My home is your home.
I ought to cut you to pieces right where you stand...
I wonder how many copies I'll sell? Hundreds? Thousands? I'll hire the finest bookbinder I can find.
The Vigilants of Stendarr, in over their heads. What a surprise.
Not like this...
Look around you. There are some extremely powerful undead here.
Even in this weather, it's better than the cave.
Hhyyaarrggh!
May mortals quake at your approach.
Are you... Did you get infected?
I'm ready to go when you are.
Surrender and give us the bow!
Farewell, friend. May the light of Auri-El illuminate your darkest hours.
A song? I, uh... I seem to have misplaced my lute. Another time perhaps?
All that just to end up dumping it out? Makes no sense to me.
Take a left up here. This is one of those weird double-barred security measures that my father put in when he got more paranoid.
May Auri-El's glow shield you from your enemy.
Leaving huh? Good. Maybe I can get some work done.
Watch out! He's pulling down the ceiling!
Not much. If you read any history, it shows up from time to time, but it's a hard thing to track.
Let's go.
Do we at least know what the vampires are after?
Arkay says bandits. Or, wait... no, he says bandits.
Well of course we do. I'm old, not stupid.
We are blood bound, but we can never be too careful. Never know who might be watching, right?
Whatever they're doing with them, they've been harvesting for millennia. No telling how many souls are trapped here.
Mind yourself in that form. Don't go damaging my thralls.
What I didn't know is someone had hired the Morag Tong to kill him as well.
All right...
If remnants of our kind who escaped the betrayal at the hands of the dwarves exist out there, perhaps they will find this place one day.
Good luck.
But I think I turned out ok.
If there's any way I can be of service, please let me know.
I believe we can prolong its salutary effects if we infuse it with potent vampiric blood.
Are you alive? I must be imagining this.
One of the feral brood has joined a group of bandits, presumably with aims to grant the gift to the entire lot of them.
In my heart, I know that it was my wife, Valerica, who took my beloved daughter away from me.
I'm... not sure. I've never heard of the Divines speaking directly to someone before.
Look, I'm just here to keep watch. What you're looking for is down inside.
Apparently you had blood in your ears when I said not to draw attention to yourself. If I wanted a messy kill I would have said so.
Nordic ruins. Even older than I am. I wonder if the draugr are as gullible as they were when I was a girl.
You really don't look well. Have you talked to Florentius? Maybe he can help you.
Were did you go?
I've located additional petrified remains of an elder vampire. Bring them to me, and I'll extend the effects granted by the Blood Chalice.
There's enough for us to fight out there. I don't need us having to defend ourselves within our own fort.
Want my advice? Never welch on a bargain with the Ideal Masters... they don't take it very well.
I took it upon myself to join the cause and fight the dremora, thinking this would simply be another feather in my cap.
So this is what it's like on the other side.
You know, an important member of society. Someone attached to the Jarl's court, a merchant, a bard, a priest, someone with stature.
A more "serious" group of the Vigilants of Stendarr. Sometimes when you skin a skeever, you find he has a more aggressive mate.
The sky is so dark. What does it mean?
Go on downstairs. You're bothering me.
Auriel is one of the elven gods. He's with the rest of them in Aetherius.
Careful, here. If you fall down that thing I'm going to have to drag you out of... wherever it leads.
The boss said it's some sort of profaned spring. It looks like blood, but it's not the real thing.
Arkay bless you, friend.
Well, that's usually the trick. It's possible to do it through a simple portal.
There are plenty of other adventures I've had over the years, but you'll just have to read my next work to find out.
If you're buying, go on in. Otherwise, shove off.
We're all that stands between Skyrim and disaster.
I will not be defeated!
Let me go...
What a horrible place.
See that thing? Dwarves called them 'Kinetic Resonators'. Don't see them very often, least not among the clans in Skyrim.
You appear to have something on your mind. What is it?
That's easy to say, but I definitely didn't help things.
Your crown... gods, it's made of Aetherium! Pure Aetherium!
Katria? No, no that's not possible!
Give up while you can!
Last I knew, he was headed to Ruunvald. But then, we hadn't heard from anyone there in a few weeks.
That's the last one, isn't it? It's... it's almost time. I'll meet you at the Forge!
I had always just assumed that the other tower was completely destroyed inside.
But bringing something from the Soul Cairn gives you something much more powerful.
If I ever see her again, she will pay most dearly for that betrayal.
Get yourself cured immediately. You're a threat to all of us otherwise.
No matter how long I've been here, I'll still never get used to this place.
It's also quite possible that there are some other isolated conclaves of snow elves nestled elsewhere on Nirn.
A magical shield that when blocked with, surrounds it's wielder with a holy aura that harms the undead.
We're looking for some Vampires that have been reported in the area. Seen any?
Auri-El forgives you.
Others think they use them as payment to an even higher power... almost like a currency. A very strange currency.
By the Eight... look at the sky!
Serana can make you one of us again.
Please... No more...
She wanted to get it as far away from my father as possible. I can't imagine a better place.
Honestly, I don't think they care what a bunch of vampires would do with Auriel's Bow. They're pretty focused on the past.
Hide if you wish. It's only a matter of time.
Oh, you're off on your own for a while? All right.
The Dawnguard are apparently focused on exterminating vampires, noble and brute alike.
I just wonder if that meant it was my job to be giving.
Mmm hmm.
Find Sorine and Gunmar, and maybe we can do something about this mess.
I am Jiub. Some call me Saint Jiub. Others call me Jiub the Eradicator. Perhaps you've heard of me?
Are you prepared to honor the mantras of Auri-El and fill your vessel with His enlightenment?
You are to destroy the feral creature before this small problem becomes a larger one.
How could they trick me like this? I was one of Reman's court wizards!
And now the feeding begins.
Next time I say to please not go over the waterfall, maybe you'll listen to me.
The sun is gone! We're all doomed!
Oh, good. Well then... let's head over to the portal vessel and I'll do the rest.
Forgive me... Auri-El...
I can't say that I'm surprised by your answer. Until I get my second volume published, no one will ever know of my achievements.
This weather is incredible.
I cast you out!
It might take decades to restore the castle to its former glory... but I appear to have plenty of time.
Correct. We only numbered perhaps a hundred at the time, so our presence remained a secret to the dwarves and the Nords.
Fellow hunter, we're looking for some Vampires that have been reported in the area. Have you seen any?
Thank you. I'll be going.
Gah!
I'll fight anything that can be fought. Beyond that... I don't want your death on my conscience.
Go to Lord Harkon at once, beg him to turn you back. You're dead if you don't.
Dexion said something about that scroll. What was it... something to do with dragons I think?
I can't afford to make any assumptions. That's how people wind up dead.
Well met, sister.
The reason I had it... and why I was down there.
Excellent. I trust he'll find his situation more accommodating, now that he is a member of the family.
I commanded every vampire in the court to look for them, but after centuries of searching without success, I lost hope.
That will make them all more upset to have one of their citizens slain, and under such flimsy pretense.
I can take you to any port on the coast.
All I heard is that without a Septim sitting on the throne of the Empire, the Dragonfires in a place called the Temple of the One were no longer lit.
But a kill is a kill, and it'll send a message to the Dawnguard, if not exactly the one we wanted.
That's the last of them. Poor sods can't resist after they get a taste of your dosed Skooma.
Are you infected? Keep your distance from me.
They used to criss-cross the skies over Morrowind like vermin. Nasty flying creatures with a habit of sneaking up on the unwary.
Back to visit Jiub the Magnificent, eh?
What? Are you certain?
Don't make a big scene. Don't get caught.
Arkay, we're going to need your help more than ever.
Turns out my mother was sneakier than I thought. I wonder what she's hiding?
One of the feral brood has joined a group of nercromancers, presumably with aims to grant the gift to the entire lot of them.
Look at you, wandering around causing trouble. Precious.
Unnff!
I wonder if the fires are still burning in the Imperial City...
I'll be with the Dawnguard if you need me.
Probably to avoid whatever my father would do to her if he could get his hands on her.
Normally, I'd send you to the Imperial City in Cyrodiil to seek answers at the Imperial Library, but that avenue no longer exists.
But to finalize the deal, you have to travel here yourself... and most of them never come back.
How dare you profane this place!
Let's just say I sold something to a guy who turned out to work for a whole coven of necromancers.
Excellent. I knew I could count on you. That's one less trouble maker to keep an eye on.
Wait... Serana? Is that truly you? I cannot believe my eyes!
I'll feed your corpse to the Betrayed.
I will find you...
Death first!
My sister in darkness. While it's good to see you, we'll keep up appearances, yes?
I must return to the frontline Alessian headquarters at once... lives are hanging in the balance!
Maybe I can't leave, but my writings can.
None of this feels right. We need to know more.
Is... everything all right here?
I didn't say that. I wondered if perhaps he did it for the attention, but every now and then he'll say something that makes me reconsider.
I'll scatter your ashes myself!
I hope you find life in the castle to be to your liking.
You've arrived at the Wayshrine of Resolution.
Madness. It was madness to attack that coven of witches! Why didn't they listen to me?
Just get all of the ingredients into the vessel.
Stay vigilant, friend.
Not at this rate, no.
I will send you back to the shadows!
Not... over... yet...
Don't speak to me, meat.
Keep quiet! We're hunting vampires spotted in the area.
May Auri-El's brilliance illuminate your path.
If there's anything at all I can help you with, please ask.
So why don't you just drink the blood from the spring? I mean, that seems easier than running a skooma den...
My father's never been much for building things, so it just stayed like this.
So, you think he's just crazy?
You've given up the powers granted to you? Get away from me. I don't want to be seen talking to you.
Farewell, friend. May the warmth of Auri-El provide you strength.
We don't need competition for blood, and we don't want the mortals getting up in arms making things difficult for us.

What's wrong with the sky?
An' maybe it won't.
Unnff!
I told you, I've prepared for this. It's going to work.
I was glad to find out not only the bad rumors were true.
If I may, let me offer you a piece of advice.
Even so, I almost made it... another foot or two to the side, and the water would have broken my fall. But... nothing I could do.
Look at you. Mortal. Weak.
Not that I ever saw.
Yiiee!
Damn it, not again!
Her name was Valerica. She has been gone for so long now, I can only assume she has left this world, one way or another.
Well, that's the thing. We don't know where he is. Haven't seen him in years.
So I'm thinking that wasn't the right way.
You seem to have lost the gift that Lord Harkon gave you. I suggest you tell him at once.
Why can't I just die? I fear I'm cursed to walk this desolate land forever.
You can't beat us!
I hope you find Lord Harkon's court to your liking.
My ship... what happened to my ship? Where am I?
Come to visit this lost soul again?
Yes. I'm speaking of the Cliff Racer of course. Wretched things.
Supposedly, the bow draws its energy from the sun itself, which it why it shows up in that prophecy.
That's it...
Your husband is such a soul, and the stars appear cooperative. Now is your chance.
Why do you think I was asking?
Hhyyaarrgghh!
Hm. Did I call it "The Great Hunt" or was it just "The Hunt?" Bah, I can't remember!
Arkay warns it's baneful charge abates with each dawn. Something to keep in mind, I suppose.
Where... am I...
He'll tell you what a monster I am, that I can't be trusted... You mark my words, it's him you need to worry about.
Rrargh!
There isn't any Aetherium here, is there? Damn it!
Was it "Having the adoration of thousands..." No, wait. I could make it "the adoration of tens of thousands."
Lead the way. Take me to this "monster" of yours.
If you're so worried about the trolls, why agree to let me go ahead with it?
A swift death is all you deserve!
Bleed!
I am above the petty squabbles here. I have lived for far too long to be bothered with them.
Suits me just fine.
Oh, I see. You've decided to cease pursuing your busy schedule and wish to talk now. How kind.
Have you made up your mind?
I hope you comprehend killing better than you comprehend speech.
Do you... know what you're doing?
We'll speak again soon.
You've done exactly as I predicted and brought your fetching companion to me.
Unnnnhhh...
It's good to speak to you again.
Hunh!
Don't leave, you'd have better dreams here...
May not look like much, but my boat can get you there faster than walking.
Wagh!
See you.
Well, using an arrow with the bow that's been dipped in blood may cause it to function differently... corrupting its purpose.
I can't wait to see the courtyard again.
And you think I do? Humph.
Maybe that's why I worked so hard to redeem myself once I was freed.
Ohhh... that's good stuff. Believe me friend, I've tried it all and this is the best.
Keep your neck covered!
Gah!
Any luck finding my pages yet?
It is good to know that I will not have to do it alone. I am glad this Dawnguard exists.
All over Skyrim. It's my job to collect them. I try and keep something for everyone. For every taste, I mean.
Nnnnyyaarrgghh!
I find it tiring to converse with someone in that form. Too much effort.
You're always welcome to return here at any time, of course.
Otherwise, you're a threat to all of us.
I assume that the Arch-Curate was corrupted by them when they found a way to breach the Inner Sanctum.
Besides this isn't so bad when you think about it.
Well, go on! What are you waiting for?
Your suffering will be legendary!
Let's check that out.
If he's moved on, perhaps the Vigilants there can tell you where he's gone.
I'll hang back for a bit, but you're not leaving me behind. This is too important.

Indeed I was. I hunted down and killed every last one of them. Took years.

Must stay away from the Keepers... must stay away from the Keepers.
Skyrim is ours!

Help yourself to anything you need in my laboratory.

Wait, please! Don't leave me for the wolves to find!
Aggh!

The more they worry, the more they talk about it. I've been hearing rumors for a bit now.
Arrrgh...
Bring the Dawnguard honor.
They could be underground, flying above us... They might be the ground. I have no idea.
Hrargh!
I miss my homeland, but I can't say that I miss all the noise!
Well, that's certainly a line of thinking I can relate to.
What... have I done... Auri-Eil forgive me...
I finally bit off more than I could chew.
If you wanted to bring some to me, I'd be happy to provide you some of the extract. It should help resist the draining aura of the crystals.
We have not finished speaking yet. Come back at once.
I'll also assume Vyrthur didn't exactly give you the option to stay your hand.
Hunnnhh...
There you are. Looks like this place has been cleaned out. At least the shard is still here...
So maybe you could ask Isran if he knows anything? Just keep in mind that he... well, he might not like the idea.
I know your friends would probably want to kill everything in here. I'm hoping you can show some more control than that.
At this rate, my first volume will be complete. Don't give up.
May you always prevail.
You're no match for me!
You seem tense. Join a booth and relax a bit. Or did you need another fix?
No, no. You must speak with Lord Harkon, not me!
Well, go on, take it!
It is a rather well-kept secret.
Gods curse you!
I lost two wives to vampires. I will avenge them.
Come on, I think it's over here.
See you around... if you live long enough.
You don't know what it's like, coming from a family like that.
Now what was it I said to that prisoner? "Stand up, there you go. You were dreaming..." Yes, that was it.
I'll admit, I don't know that I can trust you, but I know I can't rely on the Vigilants for anything. So we'll have to work together for now.
Not the most solid construction here. About what I'd expect from... creatures like this.
This is a waste of time.
Don't try and impress me. It only leaves you looking foolish.
That damn dremora and his minions. They didn't even give me a chance to explain who I was.
The Chalice has been in Lord Harkon's possession for quite some time now. It is, when used properly, able to increase the potency of our powers.
Your pathetic powers are no match for mine!
These Vigilants never know when to give up. I thought we'd taught them enough of a lesson at their hall.
Allow me to gather some of my things and I'll head back to Castle Volkihar.
Their hearts are in the right place, of course. But Isran and I were never comfortable.
We'll need to watch our steps inside.
But please, do be discreet. Our aim isn't to stir the nest, just to skin a rat, reminding them that they are the prey.
This vampire showed up while you were away.
The Hall was a place of respite, learning and comradeship, where a road-weary brother or sister could rest for a time in peace and comfort.
Of course there are. Most of us spend our lives as nomads, traveling from place to place in our endless war against evil.
Maybe we should try asking at the College of Winterhold. Sounds like something they'd know about.
How about you pay for your habit like everybody else. We're not running a charity here.
Looks like they're better at making traps than they are at making bridges.
Poor thing. I know it would have tried to kill us, but still...
This is incredible. It's like a whole other world.
Emptiness consumes me.
Does this ice feel a little... thin to you?
That... has to be the place. I've never seen a building like that before.
Death is but a door, time is but a window. I'll be back.
This is a statue of Auriel, but it's using the older signs of his power. This temple must be ancient.
You know I'm more than capable. Why are you bringing this up?
I don't relax. Ever.
Why her? What significance does she have? We don't have enough information.
Well, it seems the Dawnguard really is needed again.
As far as I know, though, it's never been held by a vampire. That would be a new one.
How dare you set foot in here, after being infected by those foul beasts?
I am at your service, as always.
Die, heathen!
That's of course if you're foolish enough to try it.
Good thing the boss heard that old farmer running his mouth off in the tavern about finding this place.
Anyway, enough of that. Let's get started.
It was a little... quieter... back then. Guess a little vampire girl was enough to scare off the rats.
This leads out to the courtyard. Just head for the door.
Who knows? It was in shambles when we first got here.
My mother kept this a secret, even from me. She must have been up to something she thought was dangerous.
My mother had a bit of a thing for magical constructs. Not... not what you're thinking. She just found them fascinating.
May Auri-El's radiance fill your heart with joy.
I'll stain the ground with your blood!
Like I said, we were never very close. Not a lot of father-daughter bonding if you know what I mean.
Sorry, I know you're trying to help. Thanks.
I murdered others for money. And before you think I belonged to some romantic or secretive guild, think again.
I know that in my head. But I just can't help feeling bad about... the way things are.
Anyway, we should keep moving.
Die, damn it... die!
If you think of any juicy details to add to my work, let me know!
Oh, they definitely were.
Oh, definitely. Mother would have plenty of those materials in her laboratory, you just need to find them.
Enough of these games. Fight me!
Leave me be.
So this is where your Vigilants came from? No wonder you look so lost all the time.
I await your answer.
Serana can change that. I suggest you ask her to.
You are worth very little if you're not one of us.
Mortals aren't allowed to freely roam the castle. Not even you.
Oh, wait a moment. Here, I want you to have these before you go.
Damn it. How could I be so foolish?
You're mortal? What are you doing here like that?
Then it's almost over. We can finally rewrite the prophecy as we see fit.
My wares? I, uh... Oh so sorry, I'm all sold out.
It is a cherished gift you have given me. To see the world this way, through your eyes. It will only bring us closer.
Feed well.
Without the royal blood flowing through you, you're one step away from the rest of the thralls.
You disrespect Lord Harkon by walking around here like that. Go see him at once, else you might find yourself in a cage.
May your blades stay sharp.
You'd best beg Lord Harkon to turn you at once. Although, you do smell delicious...
Ask Serana to make you one of us again, before someone makes a meal out of you.
You can't walk around here like some common mortal!
You'd best find him soon. Ask him to change you back.
Relieved... I think.
You would dare show up here after becoming mortal, abandoning all that Lord Harkon has granted you?
Hopefully he'll be gracious enough to make you one of us again.
Best not to damage our reputation. Let your actions be as discrete as possible.
There you are. Give me a hand with this door, would you?
I had thought better of you.
And what exactly are you going to pay me with? Take a look around. Gold doesn't exactly win you any friends around here.
With any luck he'll bleed to death before anyone notices. A cold corpse will say what we want better than a warm one.
Die!
So these Initiates had to lug around a heavy pitcher of water. Marvelous.
Great gift of blood you've given me. Blood that boils in my veins. Gives me strength.
A wondrous blade... ahhh, never mind. Just take the darn thing.
Well, I hate to see it go, but what am I gonna do with it here anyway?
I know this isn't an easy choice. Take your time.
Well, it started with the followers of Mehrunes Dagon having Emperor Uriel Septim VII assassinated.
It's not working! Try something else!
Almost as much as we like killing them.
There's no escape.
This won't stop your soul from getting ripped out, but at least you'll look good when your corpse hits the ground.
Oh sure, keep pestering me then, by all means.
They're a splinter group of the "Vigilants of Stendarr." A bit more ambitious, it seems.
Their focus will be shifted from us, giving us one less nuisance to deal with.
All right.
Isran has a problem with most people, if you haven't yet noticed.
Arkay and I will stand triumphant!
The one with the ruined castle? Don't you know that place is cursed? Even seasoned sailors steer far around that place.
It is good to have powerful allies, is it not?
Yeah, all right. I'll take you as far as I can.
Speak with Isran. He has something for you.
You just enjoy the fresh air and leave the rowing to me.
The people of Morrowind were so grateful to have the roads safer again, they took to calling me "Saint Jiub" and then the other names followed.
Looking to hire a boat?
Stay alert.
Don't get in my way, and I won't tear your arms off. Simple, isn't it?
Sometimes he doesn't even have to say it.
Absolutely. I can only do twenty at a time, so if you want the rest of your arrows blessed, let me know.
I was sure I heard something.
Definitely. You must think my life has been so strange. It sounds like your family wasn't nearly as fractured as mine.
Back to the darkness with you!
Where is this "Darkfall Cave?"
Back, godless beast!
I think he had regular contact with the Vigilants, and I know Isran kept track of them...
Can you feel it? You're now so much more than you were before.
Speak with Vingalmo. He has something for you.
Be sure to enjoy some of our Redwater Skooma before you leave.
All I remember is that damn dremora and his minions bursting into my home and sending me to their prison.
The potency of the Blood Chalice is beginning to wane. We must infuse it with more power if we are to keep it's fullest effects.
You're welcome here, as long as you don't overfeed on the thralls.
You must be clever. Find a way not to be caught or accused of murder.
Which, I'm sorry to say, means your usefulness is at an end!
Very well. I suppose a moment or two of my time couldn't hurt.
I'm still hard at work on the second volume of my epic.
You contracted a disease, perhaps, but you are no true vampire.
Those twisted creatures you call Falmer, I call the Betrayed.
This is the most peace and quiet I've had in a lifetime.
I will say only that we did not part on good terms.
They were both drunk with power, and pulling in different directions.
The only things that can survive here are the Ideal Masters, the undead and the souls themselves. Well, if you want to call that "living."
Keep going...
I immediately realized things must be pretty bad. Looks like I was right.
These pages meant the world to me. Thank you!
Still, those of us here have as much of an obligation to protect Skyrim as any other, wouldn't you agree?
The reason I'm standing in front of you as only a whisper of my former self should tell you that.
A cadre of lesser beasts has become a nuisance, taking too bold an approach to their feeding.
I miss the warm sunshine. Green grass. Blue skies. I miss being alive.
Skyrim will be purged of your filth!
Half the pages, eh? You're getting there.
You again? I thought it was clear I was busy.
That's over half of the pages found. Keep it up!
I can't believe I lost those pages.
Hey, where are you going. I need those pages!
Climb on in and let's get this over with.
You did it! You have all of my pages!
Hello there.
How dare they cast me from the Battlespire! I will make them pay dearly.
Speak with Feran Sadri. He has something for you.
"Just step into the painting" he said. Yeah, sure... like it's that simple.
I'm guessing it's the one you found in Dimhollow Crypt. Says it's got something really important to say to you.
Damn Akaviri Shaman... how could I know it would trap my soul?
They mentioned some place called Dimhollow Crypt, but I don't know where that is.
I doubt very much that they'll hasten to exact revenge for freeing me from the ruins.
Now, where was I...
I can't decide which parts of you I'd like to keep for a while...
Slay any vampires lately have we?
I remember she use to keep a small journal. See if you can dig it up.
When I rewrite those pages... they'll see what they missed.
That was a dark time in my life. I did a lot of things I ended up regretting.
An old jetty where boats would bring supplies to the castle. Once we moved in, it never got used, along with the rest of the undercroft.
Hmph. Beat me to it, this time.
Feast on life, friend.
Sounds useful.
Farewell, friend. May the radiance of Auri-El fill your heart with joy.
Once I get it done, first I'll publish a regular edition, then the folio. I'll be rich!
Perhaps it was nothing after all.
The water from the spring makes the skooma so much more potent, we'll have all the thralls we'll ever need.
Something's not right here. Be careful. I think we may be in for some trouble.
Absolutely. I've spent a great deal of time perfecting an extract that increases the potency of soul husks.
What's happening...
Speak with Gunmar. He has something for you.
You've heard of the Bloodstone Chalice?
That bark's pretty fragrant, no wonder the moths are attracted to it.
Fine, don't worry about it. When we get in, you won't have to babysit about me any more.
What's that, Lord? Well, should I tell her?
May the blessings of Auri-El protect you as you climb the road to the Inner Sanctum and final enlightenment.
Why?
I trust you're faring well?
The sun's gone dark. What could be happening now?
As I've told you before I'm a Daughter of Coldharbour... offspring to Molag Bal.
If I can remain useful, those above me will see fit to keep me here.
Unfortunately, we were constantly at war with the Nords who claimed the land as their ancestral home.
Look at the sky... the Divines must be angry with us!
Take care of yourself.
Careful now... this area's not stable.
Every last drop of your blood is mine!
These Vigilants are nothing but talk.
Ah, it's so good to breathe again!
We left together, but that partnership didn't last very long. I didn't agree with some of his methods.
Climb on in the boat and get comfortable.
My what? Wait. That means...
Give Harkon my regards... and a dagger to his heart.
Where'd you come from?!
Oh. Well, I'm not sure. I guess it came from fighting them, thinking "what could be worse?"
Speak with Fura Bloodmouth. She has something for you.
Rargh!
Or maybe her plan was to come back, but she was stuck here. We won't know until we find her.
Your deception is useless. I'll find you.
Well Arkay isn't going to intervene... not here, not now. Best point yourself towards Morthal, find a man named Falion.
Not even the gods will show you mercy!
Nnnnyyaarrggh!
It's difficult to have a conversation with you like that. Would you mind changing back?
Come now, you think you stand a chance against me?
He can help you. Go now, please, before you lose control of yourself.
Keep that in mind, will you?
Is this a dwarven city? I can't believe they'd let it get so run down.
You have done well.
Huhn!
Speak with Garan Marethi. He has something for you.
Well, that's the second one - we're halfway there. I'll keep looking. See you soon!
Thanks again for searching. I don't know what I'd do without my pages.
New blood, eh? Let's get something very clear.
Well, I think it's specifically the black ones. I don't know if the Soul Cairn takes just any leftovers.
No. I try to avoid it. Always seems to end in an argument. You?
Testing this will require some extra precautions, I think.
So, this is snow elf magic. Incredible.
Yes. They swarmed the Chantry in vast numbers until we were completely overrun. We never really stood a chance.
Seems the previous incarnation of the Dawnguard had, at one time, some interesting toys.
That's enough!
Arkay says you'll be facing forsworn.
As long as we can get this "Vyrthur" out of the Sanctum, I think they'll be happy to just hand it over.
The effect around you looks an awful lot like that huge column of light shining on the dais.
Are you okay? Almost thought I lost you there... you went white as the snow.
You've mistaken me for someone who cares about you and your problems. Find someone else.
By the Divines... you're infected. What are you doing here?
Was there something else?
Hunh!
They probably would have tried to kill her, and that has a way of souring relationships.
Hunh!
He'll cozy up to you, use his honeyed words to get you to lower your guard, then use you and throw you away when he's done with you.
If we follow that path around, we can find the other switch.
Quite bold, to return here as a mortal. Some will take offense.
If you're not one of us, you're just another piece of meat.
Gah!
And then realizing a troll with armor is even more intimidating.
You can't hide from us!
Must be gone now.
Huhn!
Can't help you, friend. I might remember better if my pockets weren't so light.
This is no place for you.
Terrible, simply terrible.
Wagh!
Hmmm, I'd say five of them would be enough.
Maybe you're finally ready to list to me.
Oh, look at you. What've you done? You've gone and gotten yourself turned into one of them.
Most of our learning could be found there. We always studied our enemies, so we might better learn how to defeat them.
It's like I said, I'm not going to talk about it.
You've found her journal!
I never knew what became of Kvatch. I wonder if they were triumphant without me.
Damn! What the...
You have no dominion here!
Nature will take care of the rest.
This stranger aligns herself with those that would hunt you down and slay you like an animal, yet I should entrust you to her?
Good to see a new face here. Especially one that isn't attached to an elf.
I had just moved from my ancestral home in Morrowind to the continent of Cyrodiil.
A pristine copy of my first volume. Only one in print, actually.
Another time, perhaps.
If you need anything, say the word. I can still forge a decent blade.
Still, it's my duty to help protect Skyrim as much as any Nord's, don't you think?
Fine, suit yourself.
You here for the Skooma? Head around inside, there's a trap door that'll lead you in.
Not a lot of our kind here, I see. Suppose I shouldn't be surprised.
Well, I don't know. Everything seemed fine until that dremora attacked me. I only heard later about the gates from the other souls.
I'll tell you, the only thing more surprising than hearing from Isran after all these years was hearing that he wanted my help.
The steam! Quick, shut it off!
Watch yourself.
Nothing. Well, not on purpose. But you never know. The strangest accidents can happen at any time.
Another elf, I see. I'm sure Vingalmo will be sizing you up as we speak, trying to figure if you're friend or foe.
Orthjolf, for example. He'll tell you he means well, but believe me, he can't be trusted at all.
This place tears at me as though I'm still alive and being drawn and quartered. I... can't stand it anymore.
What about Auriel's Bow? Do you know where we can find it?
I used to hide down here and look out at the sea. Usually when my father was in a bad mood.
The way I've heard it, the sun represents the connection from our world to theirs.
Did you know I visited Elswyr once? What a strange and wondrous place.
Rrargh!
Your existence is meaningless!
Begone, foul creature!
I heard what's going on. The vampires, the Dawnguard, all of it. I wanted to help, so here I am.
Vampires, perhaps?
Now that the first volume's complete, there's no much left to do but begin work on the second.
But none of that matters now.
Exactly.
Get out while you can.
His ambition will justify any actions. Put your faith in him, and you will regret it, I promise you.
I've waited so long for this moment. We found it. At last.
Then it's almost over. We can finally put an end to this ridiculous prophecy.
Then I'll take it from your corpse! Kill him!
Guards! Kill him!
You... you know too much. I can't afford to let you live.
Still over half the pages are missing. Keep trying.
If you were to bring me some good quality elven arrows, I could imbue them with the proper incantations and rituals.
Yes. These vampires are a new threat, and a truly deadly one.
Of course not. He's an elf, isn't he?
What?
They represented the steps the Initiates took on the path to total enlightenment.
Rargh!
Sometimes you get one who comes willingly, but most have to be convinced to join us here.
I see you, heathen!
The reason I was down there... and why I had the Elder Scroll.
And I'm not half the vampire Lord Harkon is. Truth is I'm better with a forge than I am with claws or fangs.
Vampires enjoy stalking their prey. Passing among us undetected emboldens them. Makes them feel powerful, untouchable.
For the Dawn!
Have to say, I'm glad that's over.
You've gone from a between-meal snack to the darling of the court. Impressive.
Next thing I knew, I arrived here.
Nature will do the rest.
Then I see nothing preventing my return to Tamriel.
Try... taking it out?
Auri-El bless you, child. For you are a step closer to the Inner Sanctum and everlasting wisdom.
So you found the Moth Priest. Let's see you find the rest of the Elder Scrolls all on your own.
All those things had been building for a while. You have no idea how long I wanted to say that to her.
Hey there, friend. If you're looking for a fix, you're at the right place. Just head on down the trap door.
An old escape tunnel from the castle exits there. I think that's our way in.
Don't get yourself killed!
Do you think Florentius really talks to Arkay?
Certainly not enough to devolve them into the sad and twisted beings they've become.
Maker... it can't be. Serana?!
It's Durnehviir... he's here! Defend yourselves!
Ran off, I suppose.
He claims to serve loyally, but he really covets the throne. He sees himself in charge someday.
You know you can't win, so all you can do is hide...
I can't imagine that opinion has changed.
I was close with my mother, but she just kept feeding me her opinions of him, and eventually I started believing them.
I guess we should have seen this coming... Moth Priest, moths... they're apparently related in some way.
I'll take you as far as I can, but I'm not hanging around and it's gonna cost you extra.
No, but there's no way she would have left it in Tamriel.
I'm not backing down!
Nooo!
I try and meet the needs of everyone here. No reason for any of us to go hungry.
Wow.
Oof!
Excellent, here you are.
Yeargh!
Yeeeaarrggh!
He was obsessed with power. She was obsessed with seeing him fail. It was just so... toxic.
Pitiful sorcery. You'll not stay hidden long.
Now that my brother's dead, it's quite possible I'm the last of our kind.
Rargh!
I've heard the rumors around Skyrim. I know something's going on. And I've seen the vampires.
You there, bring me another bottle of skooma... wait, who are you? You look like fun. Pull up a seat friend.
Hunh!
Oh, this is simply getting infuriating!
Often I take on tasks that Garan or Feran find distasteful, or... beneath them.
Nothing you can't handle.
You never asked me if hiding me in that tomb was the best course of action, you just expected me to follow you blindly.
Serana and her mother disappeared long ago.
The corpse is to be the message, not the attack.
There's no need for that kind of talk. I said it was possible.
Speak with Isran. He has something for you.
Keep your guard up.

Me too.
For the Dawnguard! For Skyrim!

Let's move.
From the castle, you used to just be able to see Solitude over the mountains. It's exactly what I imagined.
Oh, I'm sorry. Didn't mean to bring up a bad memory.
Good luck out there.
Who are the contenders?
Keep your guard up.
It's like the world is alive again. Just like me.
I knew you'd miss me.

I think I'll hang on to my things, thank you.
Rocks and valley, crevices and hiding places. This is the kind of place where hermits and fanatics dwell.
This place makes me a little uneasy.
I'm okay with the dark, but I've spent more than my share of time in caves already.
This land feels... twisted. I'm surprised my father didn't want to live out here.
I am but your humble servant, milady.
Yes, how may I serve you, milady?
They used to call Windhelm, "the City of Kings." In my books, anyway.
It's been a long time since I felt that way and it's been long overdue. My thanks, to both of you.
Glad to see you've taken care of your little problem, and kept it from becoming my problem.
This must be that beautiful Skyrim weather I've always heard about.
What?
Keep strong, and eyes open. We're on a different path now.
Please, let's hurry. I need to get home so I can figure out what's happened.
It's so bright out here. I don't know how you stand it.
Yes, let me show you.
It looks like some kind of temple.
If you can prove you're reliable, maybe you can join the Dawnguard. We have ways of dealing with vampires.
You're lucky Isran hasn't killed you outright. Get cured while you can.
I always wondered what the dwarves actually looked like. I hear they're like elves, but with beards.
And I thought the Soul Cairn was creepy.
There's not a whole lot to tell.
So this is the grand tour of Skyrim's caves that you're showing me?
Good, let's get inside there. The sun is starting to get to me.
(Bark)
Gunmar, there's an area large enough for you to pen up some trolls, get them armored up and ready for use.
It... almost doesn't even look real. You know?
Never saw anything like this back on the island.
Alright! One more set of dwemer plans to go.
How much longer can you keep this up, Moth Priest?
This is the kind of thing I've been wanting to see.
I never knew it would be this beautiful.
It's like from the stories I used to hear... the two adventurers seeing the world.
I'll remember this.
I'm glad you're here with me.
Oh wow. This is gorgeous.
I'm not talking about this with you any more.
Did you hear something?
I don't know, maybe. Won't know until we get him out of there.
Here comes another one!
If there's assistance I can provide, just ask. It's the least I can do.
No... Serana... your own father....
I'll see you when I'm done. For now, I need to just do this.
Oh. I didn't even know. Is it a happy home?

Die, you traitorous dog!
By the blood...
Sorine, you'll find room to start your tinkering on that crossbow design you've been working on.
I'll have some for sale soon.
Here. Let me show you how this works...
No, you've proven your strength to him.

I've discovered the whereabouts of a set of ancient Rings of Blood Magic.
I've located the last known resting place of a set of ancient Amulets of Night Power.
Serana isn't yours, she's mine!
Well it was... Thank the Vigilants for ruining that.
I've located one of the lost ancient Amulets of Night Power.
What about you? What were your parents like?
The amulets increase the effectiveness of your vampiric powers.

Of course. I wouldn't be telling you where to find it if I desired it for myself.
Come on. We can talk about this another time.
There you are. I'm... I'm back.
You are prey, like all mortals. I banish you!
There's a courtyard in the castle. I used to help her tend a garden there.

Hands to yourself.

Be a dear and fetch me another set of Dwemer diagrams?

Be a dear and collect these diagrams for me?

Makes everything else worth it.
I'm starting to think you like this as much as I do!

We've been so terribly fortunate. I can't wait to see what's in these drawings.
I just didn't know when.
Like that they were supposed to guard some vampire here, but wound up all becoming vampires themselves when they saw how powerful he was.
These people seem nervous, which makes me nervous.

I don't know that name. You say she's Jarl of Solitude? Who supports her?
Don't say I didn't warn you.
It's your choice whether to attempt to deal with them or force your way through.
Keep in mind that Redwater Den has fallen into... well, let's just say less reputable members of society now dwell there.
Welcome back.
I must have been gone longer than I thought. Definitely longer than we planned.
I'll see you soon.
That was a long time ago, but the idea was, and is, a good one. That's why I'm bringing it back.
And so I'm going to give you a chance to get yourself cured.

Well, growing up the way I did, you get used to it.
Good luck.
All clean. I feel like I can breathe again for the first time since I was turned.
We'll talk more when we're there.
Here I am. Human as ever.
It is time for action.

Arkay be with you, my friend.
Well met, friend.
Is something wrong?
By now, my daughter will have told you what we are.
I'm not sure.
My Lady.

I wonder how long they've been like this.
I don't think you can ever be ready to kill your parent.

Another victory for the Dawnguard.

Only what I've heard.
Now, acknowledge me as your master!
Thank you for breaking that foul vampire's hold over me.
(Whine)
Find all of them! Don't let any of them get away!
Are you alright? Come on, we can do this. I know we can.
Figured.
That makes sense.
Best of luck to you.
Yes, they smell like trolls. But do you have to? Consider washing up a bit more often.
I despise your presence, mortal!
Well, I'll be out of your hair soon enough.

Sorine and Gunmar are settling in.

Stop apologizing for everything.

You're a good son.

Your blood will be mine!
Let's... uh... let's just keep going.

Arvak, please! You can stop running now!

It ends here!

Oh, gods...
Come on, let's take it to Dexion.

I think you know.

Vaaz!

Stay here. I'll go check it out if you open the door back up.

Which is where you come in. If killing vampires sounds good to you, come talk to Isran at Fort Dawnguard, southeast of Riften.

If you change your mind and decide to join the fight before it's too late, go talk to Isran up in the fort.

Fools.
I understand. Take your time.
Thank you.

I guess I'll see you at Fort Dawnguard.

Break his shield! Hurry!

I'd never do anything that could hurt you.

Well I don't know what that means. But we need to find out. She must either have something the vampires want, or be someone important to them.

Tough day for you!

Harkon will reward us richly for this.

You fight worse than you smell!
Go now, and carry out this task. This is my command!
That's it? All right.
Back to dust!

What now?

Is he... like me?
That's what everybody says, right up until they find their throat being ripped out by a pack of hungry vampires.
What do you need?
May Auri-El's light guide you in your darkest hours.
I just need to be alone. For a while. There's a lot of feelings wrapped up in this old place, and I don't think you're quite ready for them.
So go and meet your beloved Stendarr.
That's... complicated. And I'm not totally sure if I can trust you.
I don't want to step on anyone's toes. Come back to me when you're alone.
I suppose you're lucky you're not dead. Or worse, one of them.
Don't let me stand in your way, then.
I think it is, actually.
That is all I have to teach you. If you wish to be reminded of these lessons, you need only ask.
Vampire, yes.
Not until you get rid of whoever your other friend is.
Come on, stoneskin!
Good. I assume you took care of that little infestation. Did you figure out what they were looking for in there?

Where did you get to?

Got it.
Oh no you don't!
I'm not going to waste my time making sure your friend doesn't get killed. When it's just you and me, we can go.
Goodbye, hero! Take good care of Arvak for me! Such a good horse...
I need someone out in the field, taking the fight to the damn vampires, while we're getting the fort back into shape...
Descend to the ground, and you can attack with your claws and feed upon your prey to regain your strength.
Done and done.
Perhaps you should. I count some of the oldest and most powerful vampires in Skyrim among the members of my court.
I don't think the vampires would be stupid enough to attack us here, but you never know.
Could you tell your companion to head home?
I will find you. Then you will beg me to let you die.
I hope the vampires try to attack us here. A lot easier than hunting them down in their holes.
A woman? Trapped in there? That doesn't make any sense. Who is she? More importantly, where is she?
Die Dawnguard!
May Auri-El's radiance fill your heart with joy.
I don't think so.
That's not a name I know. And it doesn't sound like a name a group of vampires would choose.
And frankly, I need to get home to figure out what's happening.
We're going to a place I've never been... and we're goind to see my mother. After all these years.
I'm not going to die like this!
You're not getting the best of me!
He'll help you get around this wretched place, but I'm sure he'd be much happier someplace sunnier.
Feed upon those who are sleeping, and your vulnerability to sunlight will diminish along with your powers.
It's only for Serana's sake that I have let you live.

Over time, your powers will grow in strength and you will find new ways to use your gifts.

Not just vampires. We are among the oldest and most powerful vampires in Skyrim.

Fine, then.

I'll wait for you at the dock.

May Auri-El's warmth imbue your body with strength.

The feast never ends here in Castle Volkihar.

Too slow!

<font face='$HandwrittenFont' size='16'> Lynoit,
We've received word of an increase in Vampire activity in western Skyrim. In the coming weeks, we plan to dispatch several more agents to the region, and need to establish a network of wilderness supply drops to support them.
You are to plant caches in the following locations: - On the small island south of Solitude Sawmill. - Due east of the entrance to the ruin Volskygge. - On the east side of Karthwasten Bridge.
If these reports are to be believed, the situation may be far more dangerous than you realize. Be cautious. </font>

<font face='$HandwrittenFont' size='17'> Saliah,
In the past several weeks, all of the couriers sent to replenish our supply caches in the northern reaches have gone missing. These drops must be made within the week to ensure our operatives have the provisions they need.
You are to restock the following caches: - In Morthal, on the islet due east of the mill. - Outside Nightgate Inn, at the foot of the pier. - Near Winterhold, under the great arch.
Take care. Too many of our agents have been lost on this task already. </font>
Durnehviir! Hear my Voice and come forth from the Soul Cairn. I summon you in my time of need.

<font face='$HandwrittenFont' size='20'> By order of the Dawnguard, the <Alias.Race=Player> <Alias=Player> is hereby condemned to death for the crime of Vampirism. By our authority, and with the Jarl's implicit consent, the bearer of this writ is hereby commissioned to exact justice upon the condemned wheresoever <Alias.Pronoun=Player> may run. </font>

<font face='$HandwrittenFont' size='16'> Novice Hakar,
Your repeated failures are an embarrassment to our entire order. Are you truly so inept you cannot even complete a simple courier mission?
You have one last chance to redeem yourself. We recently established a number of wilderness caches to supply our agents in the field. You are to restock the chests listed below, then report back for further orders.
Our caches in Whiterun Hold are located: - In Rorikstead, in the pasture behind Frostfruit Inn. - Near Stendarr's Shrine in the center of the tundra. - South of Whiterun's Western Watchtower.
You have one week. Return successful, or not at all. </font>

Also known as "Altmer" in their homeland of Summerset Isle, the high elves are the most strongly gifted in the arcane arts of all the races. They can call upon their Highborn power to regenerate Magicka quickly.
Blood Magic: Can pull a creature to you from a distance, and do choking damage once it's close.

<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="18">
Dear <Alias=Friend>.
I don't know how to repay your kindness, except perhaps to keep my distance so that I may not bring unwanted attention or harm to your doorstep.
Should you need to get in touch with me, come to <Alias=Dungeon>.
-- your friend

I'm one step behind the Moth Priest. After leaving Dragon Bridge, I searched along the road for any sign of his passing. I found an overturned wagon and some dead vampires and Imperial guards. Was this the Moth Priest's wagon?

Serana told me that her father was trying to gain power over the sun by fulfilling a prophecy found in the Elder Scrolls. We've set out to find a Moth Priest who can read Serana's Elder Scroll, and the trail has led us to Dragon Bridge.
Choose your Night Power (power button)

After bringing the Elder Scrolls to Dexion, a disturbing development has arisen. When reading the first scroll in front of Harkon's court, he wasn't able to fully prepare himself and he's become blind. It's now up to me to bring all three Elder Scrolls to the Ancestor Glade where I can supposedly unearth an ancient method of reading them myself.

I'm one step behind the Moth Priest. After leaving Dragon Bridge, I searched along the road for any sign of his passing. I found an overturned wagon and some dead Imperial guards and vampires. Was this the Moth Priest's wagon?

When I brought Serana back home after freeing her from Dimhollow Crypt, her father, a powerful vampire lord, offered me the gift of his blood. I accepted the gift and joined his court.
The power of the grave gives you <50> extra health.

27th Last Seed Harkon's shortsightedness is becoming a serious problem. I've warned him time and time again that his foolish prophecy would cast far too much light on our people and yet he refuses to so much as listen to a word I say. I've become less a wife and more of an annoyance in his eyes. Devoting attention to my work is the only solace I can find while enduring his ridiculous crusade. 28th Last Seed I've had a breakthrough today. I was able to attune the portal vessel to the Soul Cairn properly by using a small sample of ingredients. Although the portal opened only for a few seconds, I'm confident that with the proper formula, it can be sustained indefinitely. I feel like I'm missing a key ingredient, something of sufficient potency that can resist the forces trying to prevent my intrusion. Communing with the Ideal Masters has proved worthless. They speak in riddles and offer no assistance whether I ensure them a steady supply of souls or not. If I'm to escape Harkon's clutches, I need to keep the portal open long enough to carry me away from here... forever if need be. 3rd Hearthfire I've done it! After wasting thousands of gold coins on components, I've discovered how to sustain the portal. I'm listing the components below without the proper amounts for my own protection. As a secondary precaution, I am combining my own blood into the formula which should prevent anyone from being able to duplicate it and following me into the Soul Cairn. The formula consists of: Finely ground bone meal Purified void salt Soul gem shards Using the proper measurements, place the above in the silver-lined portal vessel and add blood as a reactive agent. I will make my way into the Soul Cairn tomorrow after I gather my things and prepare for a potentially lengthy exile. More importantly, I must enact my plans with Serana, and get her to Dimhollow Crypt as soon as possible.

When I brought Serana back home after freeing her from Dimhollow Crypt, her father, a powerful vampire lord, offered me the gift of his blood. I refused the gift, and was banished. I returned to Isran and told him what happened.
When I returned to Castle Volkihar, I was informed that Lord Harkon was waiting to speak to me.

In Arkngthamz, I met Katria, the ghost of an adventurer who perished there. With her help, I solved the Tonal Lock that protected its ruined treasury and claimed the Aetherium Shard within.

In order to locate Auriel's Bow, the Moth Priest, Dexion, indicated that two other Elder Scrolls would be required. The first scroll foretells the interactions of the dragons with the history of Nirn. The second foreshadows the defiance of the gods with the blood of mortals.
<Cool graphic>

After the Moth Priest's reading, we have more questions than answers. The old priest saw a vision of a weapon called Auriel's Bow, but we need to read two more Elder Scrolls in order to unravel the rest of the prophecy.

Harkon has ordered his court to find a Moth Priest who can read Serana's Elder Scroll. I followed the trail to Dragon Bridge and learned that a Moth Priest had just passed through town. He was last seen heading south along the road.

In Arkngthamz, I met Katria, a ghost searching for the mythical Aetherium Forge. With her help, I found the four Aetherium Shards that made up the key to the Forge, then defeated its ancient guardians.

Following Harkon's command to locate a Moth Priest, I followed the trail to Dragon Bridge. There, I learned that a rival band of vampires abducted the Moth Priest I've been tracking and took him to a place called Forebears' Holdout.
